intro: Hieracium brigantum, commonly known as the Brabant hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It features bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are rough and hairy. Hieracium brigantum is often found in disturbed habitats and can form dense colonies.
